articles.title: Deep Condolences Expressed over Death of Jo Myong Rok
articles.content:
Deep Condolences Expressed over Death of Jo Myong Rok
Pyongyang, November 9 (KCNA) -- Officials of the party, armed forces and power organs, ministries and national institutions, those in the fields of science, education, culture and arts and public health, servicepersons of the Korean People's Army and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces and working people from all walks of life Tuesday visited the bier of Vice Marshal of the KPA Jo Myong Rok, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, first vice-chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and deputy to the Supreme People's Assembly, to express deep condolences over his death.
					 Seen standing before the bier of the late Jo Myong Rok was a wreath sent by Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army. 
					
					 Also seen standing before the bier were wreaths sent by the C.C., the WPK, the Central Military Commission of the WPK, the NDC of the DPRK, the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, the DPRK Cabinet and the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces and the Ministry of People's Security, armed forces organs, working people's organizations, ministries, national institutions, units of the KPA, etc.
					
					 The mourners observed a moment's silence in memory of the late Jo Myong Rok.

articles.title: Message of Condolences from China
articles.content:
Message of Condolences from China
Pyongyang, November 9 (KCNA) -- A message of condolences came to the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and the National Defence Commission of the DPRK from the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and the Central Military Commission of the People's Republic of China on Nov. 8 over the death of Jo Myong Rok, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and first vice-chairman of the NDC of the DPRK.
					 The message says:
					
					 Upon hearing the news that Vice Marshal of the Korean People's Army Comrade Jo Myong Rok, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and first vice-chairman of the NDC of the DPRK, died of illness to our regret, we express profound condolences to the WPK, the Korean people and the KPA as well as sincere consolation to the bereaved family. 
					
					  Comrade Jo Myong Rok devoted his all to the freedom and independence of Korea and socialist cause to perform immortal feats and made precious contributions to the consolidation and development of the Sino-DPRK friendly and cooperative relations.
					
					 The death of Comrade Jo Myong Rok is a loss of an old friend for the Chinese people.
					
					 We will remember him forever.

articles.title: Wreath to Bier of Jo Myong Rok from China
articles.content:
Wreath to Bier of Jo Myong Rok from China
Pyongyang, November 9 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and the Central Military Commission of the People's Republic of China sent a wreath to the bier of Vice Marshal of the Korean People's Army Jo Myong Rok, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, first vice-chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and deputy to the Supreme People's Assembly, expressing condolences over his death.
					 The wreath was laid before the bier of the deceased in the Central Hall of Workers on Tuesday.
					
					 Also placed before the bier was a wreath in the name of the Chinese embassy in Pyongyang.

articles.title: DPRK Team Leaves to Participate in 16th Asian Games
articles.content:
DPRK Team Leaves to Participate in 16th Asian Games
Pyongyang, November 9 (KCNA) -- The DPRK team led by Jong In Chol, vice-minister of Physical Culture and Sports, left here today to participate in the 16th Asian Games to be held in Guangzhou of China.

articles.title: Korean Buddhist Federation Leaves for Sri Lanka
articles.content:
Korean Buddhist Federation Leaves for Sri Lanka
Pyongyang, November 9 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Buddhist Federation of Korea led by Chairman Sim Sang Jin left here today to attend the 25th General Conference of the World Fellowship of Buddhists to be held in Sri Lanka.

articles.title: Foreign Guests Here
articles.content:
Foreign Guests Here
Pyongyang, November 9 (KCNA) -- Professor at Stanford University of the United States John Lewis and his party arrived here on Tuesday.
					 A delegation of the Xinhua News Agency of China headed by Lu Jun, permanent deputy secretary of the Communist Party of China of the agency, also arrived here on Monday.

articles.title: DPRK Aerial Stunt Wins Top Prize
articles.content:
DPRK Aerial Stunt Wins Top Prize
Pyongyang, November 9 (KCNA) -- The DPRK aerial stunt "Flight over Iron Bar" was awarded the Golden Crane Prize, the top prize, at the 9th Wuhan International Acrobatic Festival held in Wuhan of China from October 30 to November 4.
					 The festival brought together famous circuses and acrobats from more than 20 countries including the DPRK, China, Russia, Mongolia and Brazil.   Put on the stage of the festival were 25 excellent numbers.
					
					 The Pyongyang Circus presented aerial stunt "Flight over Iron Bar" and balancing stunt "Pride of Scaffold Workers" representing the wisdom, spirit and fruitful work of the Korean people.
					
					  In "Flight over Iron Bar" DPRK acrobats successfully performed such complicated and difficult movements as treble flip-flap with three side turns and four back turns, winning the admiration from the members of the festival jury and spectators.
					
					 In "Pride of Scaffold Workers" acrobats built a four-layer pyramid on their shoulders standing on a single wheel before crossing a wire to be acclaimed by the spectators for presenting high technique and refined skill.
					
					 The Golden Crane Prize went to the DPRK aerial stunt "Flight over Iron Bar" flawless and refined in its technique and artistry and the Silver Crane Prize to the balancing stunt "Pride of Scaffold Workers."

articles.title: Project for Reclaiming Punjiman Tideland Completed
articles.content:
Project for Reclaiming Punjiman Tideland Completed
Pyongyang, November 9 (KCNA) --The project for reclaiming Punjiman Tideland in Ongjin County of South Hwanghae Province was completed. 
					 The reclaimed tideland is the country's another asset of eternal value created in its western coastal area thanks to President Kim Il Sung's great idea of remaking the nature and under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The reclamation of hundreds of hectares of tideland will help achieve an advance in the nation's agricultural development and the improvement of the standard of people's living. 
					
					 A ceremony for its completion took place on Nov. 9.

articles.title: Opera Produced by DPRK-China Friendship
articles.content:
Opera Produced by DPRK-China Friendship
Pyongyang, November 9 (KCNA) -- The opera "Liang Shanbo and Zhu Yingtai" has been put on the stage at the Pyongyang Grand Theatre, drawing a large number of people.
					 The opera, adapted from a famous folk legend going down in China for more than 1 600 years, tells a tragic love story of Zhu Yingtai, a daughter of an influential family, and Liang Shanbo, a son of an ordinary literary man's family.
					
					 The Phibada Opera Troupe successfully created the opera true to the original and high in artistry.   
					
					 The well-written opera, made up of six chapters and twelve scenes, presents such wonderful features of theatrical arts as majestic and peculiar mixed orchestra, introduction of pangchang (off-stage songs), kaleidoscopic three-dimensional stage art, fantastic dances and fine singing and action of the performers.       
					
					 Chae Myong Sok, a section chief of the troupe and senior director of the opera, told KCNA that they had found it difficult to create an opera based on a legend of other country different in language, culture and customs but they had devoted their wisdom and energy to completing the opera on a high level.    
					
					 He also said that they would do their best to perfect the opera to contribute to developing the DPRK-China friendship.

articles.title: Cyclic Production System Proves Effective in Agriculture
articles.content:
Cyclic Production System Proves Effective in Agriculture
Pyongyang, November 9 (KCNA) -- A ring-shaped cyclic production system has been applied to agricultural production and stockbreeding in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					General Secretary Kim Jong Il, while giving field guidance to the North Phyongan Provincial Chicken Farm, the Sokjong Pig Farm and the Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm in October and November last year, underlined the need to make an effective use of the ring-shaped cyclic production system in the agricultural sector.
					
					The September 27 Chicken Farm has turned out more than ten tons of organic fertilizers a day to increase the fertility of its fodder plots. It has also raised ducks and pigs with protein feed made of chickens' excrements.
					
					The Kosan, Onchon, Sariwon and other fruit farms and co-op farms with greenhouse-shaped pigsties have benefited from the system in the output of fruits, grains, vegetables and livestock.
					
					Scores of stockbreeding farms based on the system have made their appearances on the Miru Plain.
					
					Paekam County, Ryanggang Province, has turned into a big potato producer with stockbreeding farms built on a modern line.

articles.title: Confrontation Maniacs' Piffles Dismissed
articles.content:
Confrontation Maniacs' Piffles Dismissed
Pyongyang, November 9 (KCNA) -- The gentry of the Grand National Party of south Korea, at a recent meeting of major party executives held at the "National Assembly", let loose a spate of ridiculous balderdashes that "the north is likely to come in touch with 'al-Qaida' for carrying out its terror operation against the south" before and after an international meeting, crying out for taking precautionary measures and keeping an eye on it.
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday observes this in a signed commentary.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 This is nothing but sophism that can be let loose only by those tricksters who orchestrated such an unprecedentedly hideous conspiratorial farce and charade as the case of warship "Cheonan". The ulterior aim sought by the south Korean conservative forces through this is to label the DPRK "a provocateur" and "a terrorist" at any cost in a bid to justify their policy for escalating the confrontation with it and hamstring any effort to improve the inter-Korean relations come what may. 
					
					 Accusing the south Korean authorities of kicking up a noisy row of "security" in the run-up to an international meeting, the commentary goes on:
					
					 It is the ultra-right conservative group led by the GNP that is taking the lead in this confrontation hysteria, fanning up the above-said unsavory campaign. It is busy floating misinformation about the DPRK's possible linkage with "al-Qaida," regarding the forthcoming international meeting as a golden chance. Through this it seeks to tarnish the image of the dignified DPRK and justify its stance of scuttling dialogue and rejecting cooperation.
					
					 The extreme atmosphere of confrontation created by the south Korean conservative group, ballyhooing about even someone's "possible terrorism," a sheer fiction, is nothing but the last-ditch efforts of those driven into a tight corner by the DPRK's efforts for dialogue and support from the international community.
					
					 The south Korean authorities would be well advised to stop at once their conspiratorial racket, bearing in mind that a wicked man is his own hell.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Accused of Pushing Situation to Extreme Phase
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Accused of Pushing Situation to Extreme Phase
Pyongyang, November 9 (KCNA) -- The actions taken by the south Korean group of traitors to join the experts group for steering the PSI and participate in the U.S. missile defense system are deliberated provocative acts to hamstring the process to improve the inter-Korean relations and drive the situation to an extreme phase, Minju Joson Tuesday observes in a signed commentary.
					 Recalling that the south Korean conservative authorities are asserting south Korea's joining the above-said group has a "symbolic meaning" and the like, the commentary notes that this is an act of mocking and insulting the nation.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 Explicitly speaking, the group of traitors' joining the above-mentioned group betrays its ulterior aim to plug the U.S. and its followers into military provocations against the DPRK.
					
					 As far as the U.S. MD is concerned, it is designed to threaten and attack other countries and regions by force of arms under the signboard of "defense." Precisely for this reason many countries of the world are remaining vigilant against its coming close to their vicinities and strongly opposed to it.
					
					 What is ridiculous is that the south Korean bellicose forces are employing sleight of hand to cover up their crimes. They are letting loose rhetoric that they have no plan to take part in the MD but such sophism can never work. They have long covertly pushed ahead with the moves to participate in building a U.S. missile shield.
					
					 As the reality shows it is none other than the south Korean warmongers who push the inter-Korean relations to the brink of a war.
					
					 They are sadly mistaken if they calculate they can lay an international siege to the DPRK and threaten its army and people with the WMDs put in their hands by outsiders.
					
					 They had better stop behaving recklessly.

articles.title: Illegal Acts of U.S. Forces in S. Korea Denounced
articles.content:
Illegal Acts of U.S. Forces in S. Korea Denounced
Pyongyang, November 9 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification and the Kunsan People for Achieving Peace and Reunification of south Korea issued a statement on Nov. 3 blasting the illegal acts of the U.S. forces against civilians in south Korea.
					 The statement recalled that the U.S. forces in Kunsan, North Jolla Province, have watched a south Korean electrical engineer who has worked in their base for 17 years and suppressed him on charges of "leakage of military secrets", "espionage," etc.
					
					 The special investigation team of the U.S. forces walked him off on the groundless charge that he provided military secrets to the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification for the mere reason that he visited the church run by its representative and forcibly searched his house, the statement noted, and continued: When the U.S. forces side found no clues to his wrong doings, it finally fired him in last October.
					
					 Accusing the U.S. forces of having regularly watched not only civic and public organizations but also civilians and the church, the statement said this illegal acts were prompted by the intention to crack down upon the organization raising the issue of the U.S. military base.
					
					 The U.S. forces have no legal ground to watch and investigate civilians, organizations and the church, it held, and went on:
					
					 We can never allow the illegal acts of the U.S. forces and their presence in south Korea as they control and oppress civilians.
					
					 The statement demanded the authorities of the U.S. forces apologize to the people for their crimes and punish those involved in them.
					
					 If they turn down this demand, we will react to it with strong protest, it warned.

articles.title: Elimination of Person Subservient to Power Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Elimination of Person Subservient to Power Called for in S. Korea
Pyongyang, November 9 (KCNA) -- Civic and public organizations in south Korea including the Citizen's Solidarity for Democratic Society, the Society for Human Rights Movement, the Catholic Human Rights Committee and the Joint Action for Putting Straight the "Human Rights Committee" at a press conference in Seoul on Nov. 4 demanded Hyon Pyong Chol, chairman of the Human Rights Committee, a stooge of the puppet authorities, step down.
					 Accusing Hyon of working hard to weaken the function of the human rights activities by railroading some amendments to the rules for steering the committee, the organizations recalled that all the permanent members of the Human Rights Committee resigned in protest against his arbitrary behavior.
					
					 They lashed out at Hyon for objecting to the probe into the prosecution's investigation into the producers of "PD pocketbooks" of MBC and the clarification of the authorities' illegal investigation into civilians, etc., adding that he concluded in a brigandish manner a meeting on presenting opinions to the court bench as regards the Ryongsan tragedy, blustering that "there was no other option but to do so though he was branded as a dictator" despite the fact that the majority of the members of the committee consented to the proposal. 
					
					 His reckless words and deeds clearly prove that Hyon is no more than a lackey reading the face of the "government" in utter disregard of human rights, they stressed, calling for the immediate ouster of him from his office.

articles.title: Projected Additional Negotiations for Import of American Beef
articles.content:
Projected Additional Negotiations for Import of American Beef
Pyongyang, November 9 (KCNA) -- Opposition parties in south Korea on Nov. 5 strongly protested against the puppet authorities' plan to conduct additional negotiations for the import of American beef.
					 A spokesman for the Democratic Labor Party declared at a press conference that the projected additional negotiations would be little short of an act of violating democracy as they are aimed at seeking collusion in a secret room in violation of the right of the people and the failed diplomacy and a war declaration against them.
					
					 He stated the party would launch a sit-in strike to check the above-said negotiations and judge without fail those engrossed in sycophancy and treachery.
					
					 A spokesman for the Democratic Party held at a press conference that it has become clear that the "government" is draining on resources for the U.S., warning that all the opposition parties and civic and public organizations would never remain passive onlookers to this.

articles.title: Group of Traitors Accused of Working Hard to Violate Democracy in S.  Korea
articles.content:
Group of Traitors Accused of Working Hard to Violate Democracy in S. Korea 
Pyongyang, November 9 (KCNA) -- Civic and public organizations in south Korea including the Joint Conference of Human Rights Organizations held a meeting in Seoul on Nov. 5 denouncing the group of traitors for working hard to violate democracy.
					 Speakers at the meeting declared that the authorities' enaction of a special law allowing police and army to ban rallies and demonstrations as they please under the pretext of ensuring an international meeting indicates that the human rights abuses have gone beyond the tolerance limit.
					
					 Accusing the tyrannical forces of creating a terror-ridden atmosphere such as suspecting people and indiscriminately putting them in custody, they stated that they would stage dynamic actions to foil the repressive campaign of the authorities.

articles.title: Anti-DPRK Moves of U.S. and S. Korean Authorities under Fire
articles.content:
Anti-DPRK Moves of U.S. and S. Korean Authorities under Fire
Pyongyang, November 9 (KCNA) -- The Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea issued a joint statement on Nov. 2 in support of the first installment of the statement disclosing the truth behind the "Cheonan" case released by the inspection group of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK. 
					 The joint statement pointed out that the U.S. and the south Korean puppet authorities spread the false assertion that the DPRK torpedoed the warship "Cheonan", linking the sinking case in the West Sea of Korea with it.
					
					 The U.S. and the pro-American Lee Myung Bak clique made up the "investigation team" with representatives of those countries following them to produce the fabricated unscientific "results of investigation", it noted, stressing that such action was intended to invent a pretext for aggression by branding the DPRK as the very one who caused the "torpedo attack".
					
					 The DPRK was not the only country that denied the story about sinking of warship "Cheonan" and the south Korean people and media of other countries including the U.S., too, termed the "final report on the 'Cheonan' case" announced by the south Korean authorities a false one, it said.
					
					 It stressed that the imperialist war maniacs can never evade the judgment of history and blame for the case.

articles.title: Bulletin Issued in Bangladesh
articles.content:
Bulletin Issued in Bangladesh
Pyongyang, November 9 (KCNA) -- The Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy released a bulletin titled "The architect of escalated tension" on Nov. 3.
					 The bulletin in an article noted that the DPRK proposed to the parties to the Armistice Agreement to start as early as possible the talks for replacing the AA by a peace treaty this year, 60 years after the outbreak of the Korean War.
					
					 This peace proposal of the DPRK won sympathy and support from the broad sections of the international community but was rejected by the U.S., it said, and went on:
					
					 The U.S. attempted to destabilize the situation in the Korean Peninsula and drag its neighboring countries into arms race so as to deter the economic development of the region and provide an opportunity favorable for its munitions industry.
					
					 The U.S. administration sought to avoid the accusations against the government by displaying great influence in the settlement of international issues and create favorable environment in the off-year election this year.
					
					 The U.S. can never evade the blame and criticism from the international community for escalating tension on the peninsula.

articles.title: Story of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Story of Kim Il Sung
Pyongyang, November 9 (KCNA) -- One day in April Juche 43 (1954), President Kim Il Sung visited then Hwaam-ri, a mountain village in Jonchon County, Jagang Province.
					 Upon receiving the news of his arrival, the villagers gathered in front of the house of culture.
					
					 After exchanging greetings with them, the President talked with them about the village's farming. Learning about the manure they had applied to fields insufficiently, he asked the reason.
					
					 With nobody finding proper words to reply, he said manure should be produced sufficiently to raise per-hectare yield as the country had limited cropland.
					
					 He also said all of the houses should breed domestic animals such as pig, chicken and cattle to produce large quantities of quality manure for increased grain output.
					
					 After his visit, the peasants organized a stockbreeding team under the cooperative and raised many domestic animals and mowed the grass extensively to apply enough manure to fields.
					
					 Since then, the village has witnessed increased grain production and improvement of the peasants' living.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il expresa condolencias ante feretro de difunto Jo Myong Rok
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il expresa condolencias ante feretro de difunto Jo Myong Rok
Pyongyang, 9 de noviembre (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, visito el dia 8 el lugar donde reposa el feretro del difunto Jo Myong Rok, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del CC del PTC y primer vicepresidente del CDN de la RPDC, para expresarle profundas condolencias por su fallecimiento.
					  En esta ocasion el fue acompanado por Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema, Ri Yong Ho, vicepresidente de la Comision Militar Central del PTC y jefe del Estado Mayor General del EPC, quienes son miembros del Presidium del Buro Politico del CC del PTC,       Kim Jong Un, vicepresidente de la Comision Militar Central del PTC, Kim Yong Chun, miembro del BP del CC del PTC, vicepresidente del CDN y ministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares, Kim Kuk Thae, miembro del BP del CC del PTC y presidente de la Comision de Control del CC del PTC, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok y Hong Sok Hyong, miembros del BP y secretarios del CC del PTC, Kim Kyong Hui, miembro del BP y jefa de departamento del CC del PTC, Kang Sok Ju, miembro del BP del CC del PTC y vicepremier del Consejo de Ministros, Ri Yong Mu, miembro del BP del CC del PTC y vicepresidente del CDN, Ju Sang Song, miembro del BP del CC del PTC y ministro de Seguridad del Pueblo, Jang Song Thaek, miembro s
					
					 uplente del BP del CC del PTC y vicepresidente del CDN, Kim Jong Gak, miembro suplente del BP del CC del PTC y primer subjefe de la Direccion Politica General del EPC, Choe Ryong Hae, Kim Yang Gon, Kim Yong Il, Pak To Chun, Thae Jong Su y Kim Phyong Hae, miembros suplentes del BP y secretarios del CC del PTC, Mun Kyong Dok, miembro suplente del BP y secretario del CC del PTC y secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en la Ciudad de Pyongyang, Ju Kyu Chang, miembro suplente del BP y jefe de departamento del CC del PTC, Ri Thae Nam, miembro suplente del BP del CC del PTC y vicepremier del Consejo de Ministros, Pak Jong Sun, miembro suplente del BP y primer subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC, U Tong Chuk, miembro suplente del BP del CC del PTC y miembro de la Comision Militar Central del PTC, O Kuk Ryol, vicepresidente del CDN, Paek Se Bong, miembro del CDN, Kim Myong Guk, Kim Kyong Ok, Kim Won Hong, Jong Myong Do, Ri Pyong Chol, Kim Yong Chol y Yun Jong Rin, miembros de 
					
					 la Comision Militar Central del PTC.
					
					  Ante el feretro del difunto estaba colocada la ofrenda floral enviada por el Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					  Tambien se veian las ofrendas florales del CC del PTC, la Comision Militar Central del PTC, el CDN de la RPDC, el Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la RPDC, el Consejo de Ministros de la RPDC y el Ministerio de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares.
					
					  Mientras se interpretaba la musica de la ocasion, el Dirigente guardo un momento de silencio en memoria del difunto y dio una vuelta por el feretro muy adolorido por haber perdido al mas intimo companero de armas, camarada revolucionario.
					
					  Acto seguido, el expreso su profundo pesar a los familiares del difunto y los consolo cordialmente.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il envia ofrenda floral ante feretro del difunto Jo Myong Rok
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il envia ofrenda floral ante feretro del difunto Jo Myong Rok
Pyongyang, 9 de noviembre (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, envio el dia 8 una ofrenda floral ante el feretro del difunto Jo Myong Rok, vicemariscal del Ejercito Popular de Corea, quien fue miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, primer vicepresidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y diputado a la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la RPDC, en senal de profundas condolencias por su fallecimiento.

articles.title: Cuadros expresan condolencias al feretro de difunto Jo Myong Rok
articles.content:
Cuadros expresan condolencias al feretro de difunto Jo Myong Rok
Pyongyang, 9 de noviembre (ATCC) -- Los funcionarios directivos del Estado y los organos de las fuerzas armadas visitaron el dia 8 el lugar donde reposa el feretro del difunto Jo Myong Rok, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, primer vicepresidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, diputado a la Asamblea Popular Suprema y vicemariscal del Ejercito Popular de Corea, para expresarle profundas condolencias por su fallecimiento.
					  Al lado del feretro estaba colocada la ofrenda floral enviada por el Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del PTC, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la RPDC y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea.
					
					  Ademas, se hallaban puestas las ofrendas florales del CC del PTC, la Comision Militar Central del PTC, el Comite de Defensa Nacional de la RPDC, el Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la RPDC, el Consejo de Ministros de la RPDC y el Ministerio de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares.
					
					  Visitaron por condolencia Choe Yong Rim, Jon Pyong Ho, Pyon Yong Rip, Kim Rak Hui, Kim Chang Sop, Ri Ha Il, los veteranos combatientes revolucionarios antijaponeses Ri Ul Sol y Kim Chol Man, el presidente del Comite Central del Partido Social-Democrata de Corea Kim Yong Dae y la presidenta del Comite Central del Partido Chondoista Chong-u Ryu Mi Yong.
					
					  Ellos guardaron un momento de silencio en memoria del difunto Jo Myong Rok y expresaron profundas condolencias a sus familiares.
					
					  Ese dia, visitaron por condolencia a la Casa Central de Obreros donde reposa el feretro del difunto tambien los funcionarios del Comite de Defensa Nacional, el Ministerio de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares y otros organos de las fuerzas armadas, los oficiales y solados del EPC y de las Fuerzas Populares del Interior de Corea, los funcionarios de los organismos del partido y el Poder, entidades de masas, ministerios e instituciones centrales, los trabajadores de distintos sectores, el Cuerpo Diplomatico y el de Agregados Militares en Corea, acreditados en Corea, asi como los coreanos en ultramar.

articles.title: Expresan condolencias ante el feretro de difunto Jo Myong Rok
articles.content:
Expresan condolencias ante el feretro de difunto Jo Myong Rok
Pyongyang, 9 de noviembre (ATCC) -- Los funcionarios de los organos del partido, las fuerzas armadas y el Poder, ministerios, organismos centrales, de las ramas de ciencia, educacion, cultura y arte, y salud publica, los oficiales y soldados del Ejercito Popular de Corea y de las Fuerzas Populares del Interior de Corea y los trabajadores de diferentes sectores visitaron el dia 9 el lugar donde reposa el feretro del difunto Jo Myong Rok, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, primer vicepresidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, diputado a la Asamblea Popular Suprema y vicemariscal del EPC, para expresarle profundas condolencias por su fallecimiento.
					  Ante el feretro del difunto estaba colocada la ofrenda floral enviada por el Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del PTC, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la RPDC y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea.
					
					  Ademas, se veian las ofrendas florales en nombre del CC del PTC, la Comision Militar Central del PTC, el Comite de Defensa Nacional, el Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema y el Consejo de Ministros, de la RPDC, los Ministerios de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares y de Seguridad del Pueblo,  instituciones de las fuerzas armadas, entidades de masas, ministerios, organos centrales, unidades del EPC, etc.
					
					  Los visitantes guardaron un momento de silencio en memoria de Jo Myong Rok.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim y su comitiva recorren provincia de Liaoning

Choe Yong Rim y su comitiva recorren provincia de Liaoning
Pyongyang, 9 de noviembre (ATCC) -- Choe Yong Rim, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y primer ministro del Consejo de Ministros de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, y su comitiva, de visita de trabajo no oficial en el Nordeste Chino, recorrieron varios lugares de la ciudad de Shenyang de la provincia de Liaoning, y la de Dalian.
					　Entre los establecimientos visitados figuran la Corporacion Ltd. de Inyectores de Aire de Shenyang, la Compania de Produccion de Locomotoras de Dalian, el Grupo Iceberg de Dalian, el Grupo de Pesqueria de Liaoning, el Parque Beiling, larga reliquia historica, y otros donde estuvo el Dirigente         Kim Jong Il en mayo pasado.
					
					　Por otra parte, Choe departio en un ambiente amistoso con Wang Min, secretario del Comite Provincial del Partido Comunista de China en Liaoning y Chen Zhenggao, gobernador de la misma provincia.
					
					　Durante su estancia, los huespedes coreanos fueron invitados a los banquetes que ofrecieron en nombre comun el Comite Provincial del PCCh en Liaoning, el Gobierno Popular de la Provincia de Liaoning, los comites municipales del PCCh en Shenyang y Dalian y respectivos gobiernos populares.
